statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Utah State 80, Idaho 42
article.story: MOSCOW, Idaho (AP) -- David Pak scored 15 points to lead four Utah State players in double figures and the Aggies used an extended 37-0 run to blitz Idaho 80-42 Wednesday night in a Western Athletic Conference game. Cass Matheus and Durrall Peterson added 12 points each for Utah State (17-6 overall, 8-4 WAC), which also got 11 points from Nate Harris. Idaho (4-18, 1-10), which closed the game with a 14-2 run, was led by Keoni Watson's 13 points. The Aggies wasted little time taking control, building a double-digit advantage in a little over five minutes. Idaho managed to close within 25-17 on a Nebojsa Jakovljevic 3-pointer with 7:45 remaining in the first half, but that was as close as the Vandals would get. Utah State finished the half with a 19-0 run to take a 44-17 halftime lead. The Aggies shot a blistering 64 percent (16-for-25) from the field in the first half, including a 7-for-13 clip from beyond the 3-point strip. Pak and Peterson combined to hit six of eight 3-pointers over the game's first 20 minutes, and each recorded three assists during that span. Utah State continued its torrid pace in the second half, hitting its first seven attempts from the field to stretch its lead to 45 points with 15:07 remaining. Idaho missed nine consecutive shots to end the first half and went 0-for-14 to start the second. By the time the Vandals hit another field goal, Utah State had outscored them 40-1 over a 15:58 span. The Aggies led by as many as 50 points. They wound up hitting 56.5 percent of their field-goal attempts (30-for-53) compared to Idaho's 15-for-51 (29.4 percent) effort.
